items.sentence: I didn't think that Tom would give up like that.
I think that doing that wouldn't be a good idea.
Who do you think that Tom wants to give that to?
I think that we shouldn't let Tom do that again.
I think that it's unlikely Tom will be arrested.
Perhaps you need to do the same thing I'm doing.
If the weather's good, we'll go hiking tomorrow.
The article talks about something else entirely.
Naturally, Tom kept the best apples for himself.
You think that you can cure yourself, don't you?
Someone came out of that room just a minute ago.
Tom stopped going to church after his wife died.
It would be better to leave that to the experts.
When was the last time you and Tom went dancing?
Nothing, it seems, can stop that from happening.
Tom just got back from a three-day camping trip.
Did Tom say why he was planning to go to Boston?
Tom was playing outside the last time I saw him.
I'm not sure that Tom is ever going to be happy.
I'm usually hungry right about this time of day.
